intro: Sorindeia ngounyensis, commonly known as the Ngounyé tree, is a species of flowering plant native to Central Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant is typically found in moist, tropical lowland forests and thrives in humid, shaded environments. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
